name: Home Electrical Inspection & Certification
description: Whether you're buying a home, selling a property, or simply want peace of mind about your electrical system, Solomon Electric provides comprehensive electrical inspections with professional documentation. Our licensed electricians examine panels, wiring, outlets, and safety systems—delivering detailed reports and certifications for insurance, real estate, or personal records.
warningSignsSubheading: Professional electrical inspection with documentation serves many important purposes.

problems.title: Buying a Home
problems.description: General home inspections miss significant electrical issues. Dedicated inspection reveals hidden problems before you commit to purchase.

problems.title: Selling Your Property
problems.description: Pre-sale inspection identifies issues you can address before listing—preventing surprises and maintaining negotiating position.

problems.title: Insurance Requirements
problems.description: Many insurers require electrical inspections for older homes, 4-point inspections, or after claims. We provide documentation they accept.

problems.title: Older Home Concerns
problems.description: Homes over 25-30 years old often have electrical issues—degraded wiring, outdated panels, inadequate capacity. Inspection reveals what needs attention.

problems.title: After DIY or Unknown Work
problems.description: Previous owners may have done unpermitted work. Inspection identifies improper installations and code violations.

problems.title: Peace of Mind
problems.description: Sometimes you just want to know your electrical system is safe. Professional inspection confirms condition and identifies any concerns.

process.title: Panel Examination
process.description: We inspect your electrical panel for proper sizing, connection quality, recalled brands, corrosion, and signs of overheating or previous problems.

process.title: Wiring Assessment
process.description: We examine accessible wiring for type, condition, proper installation, and any visible damage or code violations.

process.title: Outlet and Switch Testing
process.description: We test outlets for proper grounding, polarity, and function. We verify GFCI outlets trip correctly and identify any missing protection.

process.title: Safety System Verification
process.description: We check grounding, smoke detector wiring (when applicable), and other safety systems for proper function.

process.title: Report and Certification
process.description: You receive a detailed written report documenting all findings, any concerns, and certification suitable for your intended use.

benefits.title: Identify Hidden Problems
benefits.description: Electrical hazards hide behind walls. Professional inspection catches problems invisible to casual observation—before they cause harm.

benefits.title: Documentation for Records
benefits.description: Written inspection reports provide documentation for insurance, real estate transactions, and personal records of system condition.

benefits.title: Prioritized Recommendations
benefits.description: We categorize findings by urgency—safety hazards vs. code updates vs. improvements—so you understand what truly needs attention.

benefits.title: Professional Credibility
benefits.description: Inspection by licensed electricians carries weight with insurance companies, real estate professionals, and potential buyers.

faqs.question: What's included in an electrical inspection?
faqs.answer: We examine the electrical panel (capacity, conditions, recalls), accessible wiring (type, condition, installation quality), outlets and switches (grounding, polarity, GFCI function), grounding system, and any safety systems. You receive a detailed written report with findings and recommendations.

faqs.question: Is this different from a home inspection?
faqs.answer: Significantly. General home inspectors spend 5-10 minutes on electrical—checking that lights work and the panel has no obvious problems. Our dedicated inspection involves thorough examination by a licensed electrician who understands electrical systems, codes, and safety requirements.

faqs.question: How long does an electrical inspection take?
faqs.answer: A thorough residential inspection typically takes 1-2 hours depending on home size and complexity. Larger or more complex properties take longer. You'll receive your written report within 24-48 hours.

faqs.question: Can you inspect for insurance requirements?
faqs.answer: Yes. We provide electrical inspections that satisfy insurance company requirements including 4-point inspections. Our reports include the documentation insurers need to assess or renew coverage.

faqs.question: What if you find serious problems?
faqs.answer: If we identify immediate safety hazards, we'll explain the situation and recommend appropriate action—potentially shutting off affected circuits. For less urgent issues, we include them in your prioritized report so you can plan repairs appropriately.

faqs.question: Do you provide repair estimates?
faqs.answer: We can provide repair estimates for issues we identify. Many clients prefer understanding the overall investment needed before deciding how to proceed. This helps with budgeting and real estate negotiations.

faqs.question: Will you put your findings in writing?
faqs.answer: Absolutely. Every inspection includes a detailed written report documenting our findings, any concerns, and prioritized recommendations. This documentation is suitable for insurance, real estate, or personal records.

faqs.question: Can you inspect before I make an offer on a home?
faqs.answer: Yes, pre-offer inspections are possible if the seller grants access. More commonly, we perform inspections during the inspection period after your offer is accepted. Understanding electrical condition before closing protects your investment.
